messages.title: For a better, fairer Britain
messages.content: "This election is a choice between a Britain for the few under the Tories or for the many with Labour. As your MP in Woking I would fight for better public services and a fairer society."

keyPolicies.policyTitle: End the NHS and Social Care Crisis
keyPolicies.policyDescription: This February 1,875 people had to wait more than 4 hours at St Peter's A&E. 7.3% of people compared to just 2.1% in 2013 - Fiona believes that under the Tory government has put NHS and Social Care services under more pressure, Labour would make new investments and proper plans for the NHS and Social Care.

Woking’s rail services are expensive, unreliable and overcrowded. Fiona wants to see improvements in local services with new trains, cheaper fares for season ticket holders and for the Oyster Card Zone to be extended to Woking.
Fiona campaigned for Britain to remain in the EU and is determined Britain gets the best deal from negotiations, protecting the rights of EU citizens living and working here as bargaining chips.

issues.health: End the NHS and Social Care Crisis

leaflet.personalStatement: Dear resident, I am honoured to be standing as the Labour candidate for Woking. My roots here are well known - my parents are alive. Due to a family emergency, I have come to familiarize myself with Woking and feel that Fiona would make the best MP for our future. Fiona has decades of experience and has served on the Labour council twice. This enabled her to make many beneficial changes to the government and Labour.

contactInformation.address: Mirpur House, Onslow Crescent, Woking GU22 7AY

endorsements.endorser: Mohammed Ali, Community Activist and Councillor
endorsements.endorsement: We need a strong Labour MP to stand up for Woking against Tory cuts and broken promises. Fiona has the skills and experience to best represent us and will fight on behalf all. Fiona is a hard-working and dedicated campaigner for Woking community and Labour.

images.caption: Fiona Colley and the Woking Labour Team

examples: This February 1,875 people had to wait more than 4 hours at St Peter's A&E.
Fiona campaigned for Britain to remain in the EU.
Finally, my father was an engineer and my mother was a teacher.
This election is a choice between a Britain for the few under the Tories or for the many with Labour.
I would fight for better public services and a fairer society.
Expensive and unreliable Woking’s rail services.
Fiona has the skills and experience to best represent us.
Fiona Colley and the Woking Labour Team.
End the NHS and Social Care Crisis
